text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

Changed the name and content of IRM 4.71.27.1.5 from, “Contact Information for Business Units,” to “Related Resources”. Contact Information is now found in Exhibit 13 of IRM 4.71.1 - Employee Plans Examination Exhibits. The renamed section contains a link to the Exhibit.
Added Letter 531-B as the designated 90-Day Letter for Form 5329 examinations.

Revised IRM 4.71.27.6.1(4) and 4.71.27.6.5(4) to incorporate the provisions of the October 29, 2019, Interim Guidance Memo (IGM) NHQ-01-1019-001, with the subject line, Clariﬁcation of Policy for Use of Fax in Taxpayer Submissions, from the Deputy Commissioner for Services and Enforcement.
Revised paragraph (4) of IRM 4.71.27.9.1 to remind letter users that revised Letter 2005 replaced Letter 2005-B.
Revised paragraph (4) of IRM 4.71.27.9.1 to remind letter users that revised Letter 2005 replaced
Added paragraphs (3) and (4) to IRM 4.71.27.10, Statute of Limitations for Form 5329, to reference the new RCCMS Statute Validation Process when the statute date is 270 days or less.
Revised IRM 4.71.27 to incorporate the provisions of the July 28, 2020, IGM with the subject line, Interim Guidance on Fully Electronic (100% Paperless) Cases, from the Director, EP Examinations.

Revised IRM 4.71.27 to incorporate the provisions of the July 31, 2020, IGM TEGE-04-0720-0018 with the subject line, Elimination of Requirement to Use Paper Form 895/895-EP, from the Deputy Commissioner, TEGE.

Revised IRM 4.71.27 to incorporate the provisions of the September 22, 2020, IGM 0021 with the subject line, Interim Guidance on Reporting Compliance Case Management (RCCMS) Electronic Case Policy, from the Deputy Commissioner, TEGE.

Revised IRM 4.71.27 to incorporate the provisions of the December 14, 2020, IGM TEGE-04-1220- 0026 with the subject line, Requirement to use Form 5773-A (Rev. 12-2020), and eliminating required use of Form 5772-A, from the Director, EP Examinations.

) This IRM section is authored by EP Mandatory Review. For questions, tion or suggestions, contact the manager of EP Mandatory Review (
) Employee Plans (EP) Examinations division determines if a retirement plan qualiﬁed under IRC
and the underlying regulations, and therefore, from tax under IRC
) The EP Examination program’s primary objective is regulatory, continued qualiﬁcation of employee beneﬁt plans (Policy Statement

). selects and examines returns to: a. Promote the highest degree of voluntary compliance with the tax laws plan qualiﬁcation. b. Determine qualiﬁed plans’ extent of compliance and the causes of compliance with the tax laws. c. Determine whether such plans meet the applicable qualiﬁcation ments in operation. (
) Under Policy Statement
, EP agents and managers are: a. Given broad authority to consider and weigh conﬂicting information, and opinions.
IRC section 7602 - Examination of books and witnesses, which falls under Chapter 78 - Discovery of Liability and Enforcement of Title.
Note: IRC
provides agents with the authority to: (cid:
) Examine any books, papers, records or other data necessary to complete an exam. (cid:
) Take testimony under oath to secure additional information needed.(cid:

Note: EP Examinations’ authority to resolve issues is derived from its authority to make determinations of tax liability under IRC 6201.
a. Promote the highest degree of voluntary compliance with the tax laws on plan qualiﬁcation. b. Determine qualiﬁed plans’ extent of compliance and the causes of non
compliance with the tax laws. c. Determine whether such plans meet the applicable qualiﬁcation require
ments in operation.

Employee Plans Examination of b. To use professional judgement according to examination standards to make ﬁndings of fact and apply the IRS’s position on issues of law to determine the correct tax liability. c. To exercise this authority to obtain the greatest number of tax tion agreements without sacriﬁcing the quality or integrity of those determinations and to dispose of tax differences at the lowest level. (
) All examinations are done in accordance with Policy Statement
, Fairness and Integrity in Enforcement Selection. (
) EP Examinations established two review groups to make sure agents examinations per technical, procedural and administrative requirements: a. Mandatory Review, see IRM
, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, EP Mandatory Review. b. Special Review, see IRM
, Special Review (SR) and Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures. (
) Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) is the quality control system TE/GE uses to oversee the entire examination program. For more in- formation on TEQMS, see IRM
, Special Review (SR) and Tax Exempt Quality Measurement System (TEQMS) Procedures. (
) All examinations are done in accordance with the Taxpayer Bill of Rights as listed in IRC
Employee Plans Examination of Returns

To use professional judgement according to examination standards to make ﬁndings of fact and apply the IRS’s position on issues of law to determine the correct tax liability. To exercise this authority to obtain the greatest number of tax determina
tion agreements without sacriﬁcing the quality or integrity of those determinations and to dispose of tax differences at the lowest level.
EP Examinations established two review groups to make sure agents examinations per technical, procedural and administrative requirements:
a. For more information about these laws, visit the FOIA Library on the irs. gov website. b. For questions concerning privacy, send an email to
Privacy. c. For question concerning disclosure, send an email to

examination may originate when you determine during the: a. Form
examination, that the plan is not qualiﬁed under IRC
(a), and plan distributions were rolled into an IRA (traditional or Roth IRA). The entire amount of all rollovers from the non-qualiﬁed plan to either type of IRA are subject to IRC

tax. b. IRA-based plan examination, that the plan doesn’t comply with IRC For each year the plan is non-compliant, contributions made on behalf each participant in excess of the “traditional IRA deduction” limit under IRC
(b) are excess contributions subject to IRC
tax. Note: See IRM
, Procedures for IRA-based Plans Found to in Non-compliance and Not Resolved Through a Closing Agreement. c. Form
examination, that a participant or beneﬁciary didn’t receive required minimum distributions under IRC

For “Type” select “
Return.” b. For “Activity Code” select “

” c. Input the tax period. d. Input the return due date. e. Input the return received date. f. Input the statute date. For the “Codes” tab: a. Input the “Name Control.” b. should always be used if the return has posted evidenced by TC

d. For “Master File Type”, select IMF. e. Input the “Status Code.” f. For “Grade”, enter the grade of the related case. g. Input the “Related Return Source Code”. Note: This will usually be the Source Code of your lead examination. h. For “Return Requisition Code”, select “
- Return, Chargeout and Labels Not Requested.” i. For “MFT Code”, select

j. Ensure that the “Related Return” box is checked. k. Ensure that the “Flowthru” box is not checked. l. Input the Reason for request/Related return. m. Input comments as appropriate. n. Select “Save and Close.”

You must establish all “agreed” delinquent returns on RCCMS and AIMS when the tax due is $500 or more in any one year.
If tax is less than $500 in all years being considered, solicit Forms 5329 and establish them on RCCMS and AIMS at your manager’s discretion.

IRS can receive tax returns via fax as part of return perfection even if a taxpayer’s signature is required since Chief Counsel has advised that in cir- cumstances where we’ve contacted the taxpayer has been made and documented it, faxed signatures are legally sufficient. If you receive payment, complete Form 3244-A for each year for which the taxpayer paid as follows and place the Form 3244-A and check in a separately addressed envelope per IRM 4.71.27.6.1 (6)(f) above.

Remarks: List the check number and amount of the check. If the check represents payments for more than one year, list each year and the amount applied to each year. Prepared by: Enter the agent’s name and group number.

A Form 3244-A is required for each year for which payment is received. For example, if you receive a check from the taxpayer for $5000 that includes payment of $2000 for 201812 and $3000 for 201912, prepare a Form 3244-A for 201812 showing $2000 next to transaction code 610 and a second Form 3244-A for 201912 with $3000 next to transaction code 610. List the total amount of the check in the “Remarks” section of the Forms 3244-A.

General Disposal Code 102= “Agreed Tax Change” (Form 870-EP was signed by the taxpayer)107=“No Change” 208= “Delinquent Return Secured” (a delinquent Form 5329 is secured from the taxpayer) General ARDI Code An entry is required if the disposal code is “102” or “208”. General Closing With Make the appropriate selection in the drop down menu, but in most cases select “electronic prints” Details Examiner’s Time Time must be entered in whole hours and in tenths of hours. Details Technique Code 6- Office correspondence exam 7 – Field exam - limited scope Details Examiner’s Name Last name, ﬁrst name Details Delinquent Return If disposal code is 208 and entry is required. Code Individual/Business Agreement Date Insert the date the signed Form 870-EP is received (if appli- (1 of 3) cable). Individual/Business Tax Enter transaction code (TC) 300 and $0 if you aren’t (1 of 3) Assess- assessing additional tax above the amount the taxpayer ment Information reported on the Form 5329 you secured. If you’re assessing additional tax on Form 870-EP, enter TC 300 and the addi- tional amount of tax being assessed. Note: If you previously forwarded an agreed delinquent return that the taxpayer voluntarily ﬁled with you to the Kansas City Service Campus, the tax assessment would have been made at the Service Campus when the return was processed. To avoid double assessment, do not reﬂect an additional tax amount. Note: With Form 870-EP, assessments are made by the TEGE Closing Group.

RCCMS TAB ITEM EXPLANATION Individual/Business Penalties If Form 870-EP is signed by the taxpayer and IRC 6651 (1 of 3) Assess- penalties are being assessed, enter TC 160 with the corre- ment Information sponding amount for the IRC 6651(a)(1) penalty, and TC 270 with the corresponding amount for the IRC 6651(a)(2) penalty. Note: If you secure a delinquent Form 5329 and forward it to Kansas City, the Service Campus automatically assesses the IRC 6651 penalties unless you instruct them not to in the “Other Instruction” section of the Form 3198-A accompanying the delinquent return when you mail it to the Service Campus. Note: If the Service Campus erroneously assesses IRC 6651 penalties, they can be abated by entering TC 161 (for IRC 6651(a)(1)) and TC 271 (for IRC 6651(a)(2)), as applicable, with the corresponding amounts. Individual/Business Reference If you’re assessing additional tax from Form 870-EP (i.e., you (1 of 3) Number entered TC 300 with an additional tax assessment), then you must list a reference number (manual abstract code) here with the additional amount of tax being assessed. For example, use reference number 160 if the issue is excess contributions (IRC 4973)(a)(1) and use reference number 162 for IRC 4974 tax. Individual/Business Interest Leave blank. Interest will be assessed by the Service (1 of 3) Campus. Individual/Business Delinquent Return For disposal code 208, enter the amount of tax on Form (2 of 3) Amount 5329.

) Prepare the RAR on Form

) Organize the RAR into the following parts: a. Issue(s)– Clearly state the issues. For example, if the issue is IRC tax, the issue might be stated as follows: “Whether an excess tion to John Smith’s IRA results in an IRC
tax liability for the years ending December
, and

?” b. Facts– Include a brief history of the plan and provide pertinent details surrounding the issue. Also cite any plan provisions relevant to the raised. c. Law– Summarize Code sections, treasury regulations, revenue court cases, etc., that relate to the issue(s). Do not cite General Memos (GCM) or Private Letter Rulings (PLR) as sources of authority the RAR. d. Government’s Position– Discuss each issue separately and apply law and the facts relevant to each speciﬁc issue. Also give a summary taxes due and the applicability of penalties. e. Taxpayer’s Position– Reﬂect the taxpayer’s position including any rebuttals the taxpayer has made to the Government’s position. If the taxpayer hasn’t provided a position on the Issue(s), include a simple statement to the effect that the taxpayer has not provided a response. f. Conclusion– If the taxpayer provides a position on the issue(s), the should contain a rebuttal to the taxpayer’s position. The Government’s position should be restated as a conclusion in all cases. (
) Contact Mandatory Review for help writing your RAR. (

5329 Examination Procedures 4.71.27
Note: The year reﬂected should be six years from the date the SFR posted. For example, if the SFR posted on 10/21/2020, the statute date should be 10/
Prepare Form 10904, Request for Record Deletion from AIMS, as follows:

Field: Entry: Name of Taxpayer: Input the plan name. Name Control: Input the four digit name control. Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number: Input the EIN for the record being deleted. Plan Num.: Input the plan number for the record being deleted. Tax Period: Input the plan year for the record being deleted. Disposal Code: Select disposal code “33”. Note: If the return has not posted (there is no TC 150 posting), make sure the box next to AM424D is checked. Other: Select “Error Account”; Select “AIMS”. Reason for Request: Input a brief explanation of the requested correction.
Note: See IRM 4.71.5 - Exhibit 12 for an example of a completed Form 10904.
